intro: Gagea lutea var. glauca, commonly known as the blue-flowered gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, clustered white or blue flowers that bloom in early spring. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in dry, rocky habitats, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Gagea lutea var. glauca is often found in open woodlands and mountain meadows.
